==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=5|rs=女05}}

# [[spouse]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[さい]] (sai)
|kanon=[[せい]] (sei)
|kun=[[つま]] (tsuma), [[めあわせる]] ([[妻せる]], [[妻合わせる]], meawaseru)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つま}}
From {{m|ja|端|tr=tsuma||side, edge}}, indicating the person who is ''at the side'' of someone: a [[spouse]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Compare the {{etyl|en|-}} expression {{m|en|better half}}.

This term originally referred to either a male ({{m|en|husband}}) or female ({{m|en|wife}}) spouse.  In modern usage, this term refers only to a female spouse.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つま|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|夫}} {{qualifier|archaic}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|つま}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=つま|archaic}} the male or female partner in a [[marriage]]: a [[spouse]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=つま|humble|only refers to one's own}} the female partner in a [[marriage]]: [[wife]]
